Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that raising the minimum wage to $12 an hour would bring it back to the highest level it has ever been, when in fact it would be $1.31 an hour higher than the previous record.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the statement that raising the minimum wage to $12 an hour is the highest level it has ever been.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that raising the minimum wage is necessary and beneficial without considering potential negative impacts or alternative solutions.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or approaches to addressing income inequality or improving workers' wages that are not mentioned in the claim.
